Description: Glazed composition fragment of flaring mouth of ovoid flask in shape of papyrus flower, hollow inside. Complete in height, with wide flange at top, and narrow base, with ridge modelled with incised groove. No decoration. Glaze gone, green colour with yellowish tinge remaining, core hard greyish brown. Inside dark brown stain which extends to broken surface of core - accidental?
Dimensions: Diameter: 11 centimetres (outer edge of flare at top)
Curator's comments: Flaring mouth of ovoid flask like Seif and ed Dinn Type 7,1 , fig.11, 251-283. Nenna, M.-D. and M. Seif el-Din. La vaisselle en faïece d’époque gréco- romaine. Études Alexandrines 4. Cairo: IFAO.

Parallels dated to the 3rd century BC (Nenna 2013, Fig. 6.5, T7.1a, see also 7.1b and c). Nenna, M.-D. 2013. Faience vessels and objects in Nicholson, P. T. (ed.) Working in Memphis: The production of faience at Roman period Kom Helul. London: Egypt Exploration Society: 106-132.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.12)
